articles.title: Burford Capital stock soars as client wins liability ruling against Argentina (NYSE:BUR)
articles.description: Burford Capital (BUR) stock soared 60% in Friday early afternoon trading after a decision was made in a decades-long legal case, in which the firm holds a stake to any settlement
articles.content: Burford Capital (NYSE:BUR) stock soared 60% in Friday early afternoon trading after a decision was made in a decades-long legal case, in which the firm holds a stake to any settlement. Burford's client, The Petersen Group, sued Argentina and energy c... [1669 chars]

articles.title: “It’s So Sad and Heartbreaking” - Soccer World in Shock as Argentina Legend Sergio Aguero Suffers Medical Scare on Live Stream
articles.description: Soccer world went in shock after seeing Argentinian legend Sergio Aguero suffering another medical scare on live stream.
articles.content:
Published 03/31/2023, 11:30 AM EDT

articles.title: Argentina World Cup winner Gonzalo Montiel accused of 'sexually assaulting model at his birthday party'
articles.description: WORLD Cup winner Gonzalo Montiel has been accused of sexually assaulting a model at his birthday party in his native Argentina.Sevilla right-back Mont
articles.content:
WORLD Cup winner Gonzalo Montiel has been accused of sexually assaulting a model at his birthday party in his native Argentina.
Sevilla right-back Montiel is facing a complaint which has reportedly been filed with the courts in Buenos Aires.

articles.title: Lionel Messi made Patrice Evra cry in car after Argentina won World Cup
articles.description: Patrice Evra has revealed how Lionel Messi left him crying in his car
articles.content:
The Qatar World Cup final was an incredible match – unless you were Patrice Evra.
The former French international has said that he was in tears following Argentina’s victory.
It was a sensational clash to watch, with Lionel Messi’s team the much bett... [2736 chars]

articles.title: 'Learn to live with this:' Humboldt focuses on future five years after bus crash
articles.description: HUMBOLDT, Argentina — Kevin Garinger says it feels like the passage of time is inexplicable. The five years since a deadly bus crash changed his city, his hockey team and his life sometimes feel like a lifetime. Other times it feels like yesterday.
articles.content:
